unnormalised: **Air Quality in Indian Cities Remains a Concern, Educational Initiative Launched**
normalised: **Air Quality in Indian Cities Remains a Concern, Educational Initiative Launched**

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26 - Air quality across many Indian cities continues to be a pressing environmental concern, particularly as Diwali approaches on Nov 12. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data released at 10:00 hrs today shows that several locations, including areas in and around industrial hubs like Faridabad and Ghaziabad, are exhibiting "Poor" to "Very Poor" Air Quality Index (AQI) levels.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six - Air quality across many Indian cities continues to be a pressing environmental concern, particularly as Diwali approaches on November twelve. The Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B) data released at ten zero zero hours today shows that several locations, including areas in and around industrial hubs like Faridabad and Ghaziabad, are exhibiting "Poor" to "Very Poor" Air Quality Index (A Q I) levels.

unnormalised: Experts from IIT Kanpur are collaborating with the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change on a national educational initiative to increase awareness about the causes and consequences of air pollution. The program, launched on Oct 1st, 2023, includes online modules and community workshops designed to empower citizens with practical steps to mitigate their impact. Simple actions like using public transport, carpooling, and avoiding burning waste can make a noticeable difference, says Dr. Sharma, an environmental scientist leading the IIT Kanpur initiative. The long-term goal is to bring the annual average PM2.5 levels down to the National Ambient Air Quality Standards by 2030.
normalised: Experts from I I T Kanpur are collaborating with the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change on a national educational initiative to increase awareness about the causes and consequences of air pollution. The program, launched on October first, two thousand and twenty three, includes online modules and community workshops designed to empower citizens with practical steps to mitigate their impact. Simple actions like using public transport, carpooling, and avoiding burning waste can make a noticeable difference, says Doctor Sharma, an environmental scientist leading the I I T Kanpur initiative. The long-term goal is to bring the annual average P M two point five levels down to the National Ambient Air Quality Standards by two thousand and thirty.
